contents.title: Data Fetching
contents.description: Nuxt provides useFetch, useLazyFetch, useAsyncData and useLazyAsyncData to handle data fetching within your application.

children.value: to handle data fetching within your application.
to universally fetch data from any URL.
This behaves identically to useFetch with the
option set, so the async function does not block navigation.

contents.title: Edge Functions
contents.description: Edge Functions allow you to deliver content to your site's visitors with speed and personalization. They are deployed globally on Vercel's Edge Network and enable you to move server-side logic to the Edge, close to your visitors.

children.value: allow you to deliver content to your site's visitors with speed and personalization. They are deployed globally on Vercel's Edge Network and enable you to move server-side logic to the Edge, close to your visitors.

contents.title: Middleware
contents.description: There are three kinds of route middleware in Nuxt:

children.value: There are three kinds of route middleware in Nuxt:
Anonymous route middleware, which are defined directly in the pages where they are used.
Named route middleware, which are placed in the
directory and will be automatically loaded via asynchronous import when used on a page.
Global route middleware, which are placed in the
directory (with a .global suffix) and will be automatically run on every route change.
Test out named middleware in the following example! Without entering your user name, you will be blocked from visiting the private page.
'Sorry, you need to fill your username'
>In order to enter the secret page, you need to fill your username:</

contents.title: Nuxt Content
contents.description: Nuxt Content reads the content/ directory in your project, parses .md, .yml, .csv and .json files to create a powerful data layer for your application. Use Vue components in Markdown with the MDC syntax.

children.value: files to create a powerful data layer for your application. Use Vue components in Markdown with the MDC syntax.
Then, add @nuxt/content to the modules section of nuxt.config.ts:
To render content pages, add a catch-all route using the ContentDoc component:

Now just place your markdown files inside the content/ directory in the root directory of your project. This template was built using Nuxt Content, so take a look at the code to see a working example!

contents.title: NuxtLink
contents.description: <NuxtLink> is a drop-in replacement for the <a> tag. It intelligently determines whether the link is internal or external and renders it accordingly with available optimizations (prefetching, default attributes, etc.) You can use it just like a normal link tag, adding target and rel attributes.

children.value: is a drop-in replacement for the

tag. It intelligently determines whether the link is internal or external and renders it accordingly with available optimizations (prefetching, default attributes, etc.) You can use it just like a normal link tag, adding target and rel attributes.
Let's visit an external website using Nuxt-Link! Click the link below to
open nuxt.com in a new tab. This link is usinf the rel and target
This link will route to the /routing page within this application. Click
the link below to experience how it works!

contents.title: NuxtLoadingIndicator
contents.description: Nuxt provides NuxtLoadingIndicator to display a progress bar on page navigation that can be customized! It has the following props

children.value: to display a progress bar on page navigation that can be customized! It has the following props
: The color of the loading bar.
: Height of the loading bar, in pixels (default 3).
: Duration of the loading bar, in milliseconds (default 2000).
: Throttle the appearing and hiding, in milliseconds (default 200).
Let's use these props to customize our loading indicator.

contents.title: Teleports
contents.description:
Vue 3 provides the Teleport component which allows content to be rendered elsewhere in the DOM, outside of the Vue application. The target of Teleport expects a CSS
selector string or an actual DOM node. Nuxt currently has SSR support for teleports to body only, with client-side support for other targets using a ClientOnly wrapper.
